DataGridViewCellStyleContentChangedEventArgs Class

In this Article

Provides data for the CellStyleContentChanged event.

Syntax

Declaration

public class DataGridViewCellStyleContentChangedEventArgs : EventArgs

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.EventArgs
  • DataGridViewCellStyleContentChangedEventArgs

Inherited Members

Empty
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The CellStyleContentChanged event occurs when a property value of a DataGridViewCellStyle object returned by one of the following properties changes:

  • Style
  • DefaultCellStyle
  • DefaultCellStyle
  • RowHeadersDefaultCellStyle
  • RowsDefaultCellStyle
  • ColumnHeadersDefaultCellStyle
  • AlternatingRowsDefaultCellStyle
  • DefaultCellStyle

    If one of these properties is set to a different DataGridViewCellStyle object, however, the corresponding PropertyNameChanged event occurs but the CellStyleContentChanged event does not occur.

    Use the CellStyleScope property to determine which property has the DataGridViewCellStyle that changed. Use the CellStyle property to retrieve the updated value.

    For more information about handling events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

Properties summary

CellStyle

Gets the changed DataGridViewCellStyle.
CellStyleScope

Gets the scope that is affected by the changed cell style.

Properties

  • CellStyle

    Gets the changed DataGridViewCellStyle.

    public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle CellStyle { get; }

    Property Value

    • DataGridViewCellStyle

      The changed DataGridViewCellStyle.

    Remarks

    Use this property to retrieve the updated DataGridViewCellStyle property value. Use the CellStyleScope property to determine which property has the DataGridViewCellStyle that changed.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellStyleContentChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing Show with WriteLine or appending the message to a multiline TextBox.

    To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type DataGridView named DataGridView1. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellStyleContentChanged event. 

    private void DataGridView1_CellStyleContentChanged(Object sender, DataGridViewCellStyleContentChangedEventArgs e) {

System.Text.StringBuilder messageBoxCS = new System.Text.StringBuilder();
messageBoxCS.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "CellStyle", e.CellStyle );
messageBoxCS.AppendLine();
messageBoxCS.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "CellStyleScope", e.CellStyleScope );
messageBoxCS.AppendLine();
MessageBox.Show(messageBoxCS.ToString(), "CellStyleContentChanged Event" );
}

    Private Sub DataGridView1_CellStyleContentChanged(sender as Object, e as DataGridViewCellStyleContentChangedEventArgs) _ 
     Handles DataGridView1.CellStyleContentChanged

    Dim messageBoxVB as New System.Text.StringBuilder()
    messageBoxVB.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "CellStyle", e.CellStyle)
    messageBoxVB.AppendLine()
    messageBoxVB.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "CellStyleScope", e.CellStyleScope)
    messageBoxVB.AppendLine()
    MessageBox.Show(messageBoxVB.ToString(),"CellStyleContentChanged Event")

End Sub
  • CellStyleScope

    Gets the scope that is affected by the changed cell style.

    public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyleScopes CellStyleScope { get; }

    Property Value

    • DataGridViewCellStyleScopes

      A DataGridViewCellStyleScopes that indicates which DataGridView entity owns the cell style that changed.

    Remarks

    Use the CellStyleScope property to determine which property has the DataGridViewCellStyle that changed. Use the CellStyle property to retrieve the updated value.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellStyleContentChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing Show with WriteLine or appending the message to a multiline TextBox.

    To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type DataGridView named DataGridView1. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellStyleContentChanged event. 

    private void DataGridView1_CellStyleContentChanged(Object sender, DataGridViewCellStyleContentChangedEventArgs e) {

System.Text.StringBuilder messageBoxCS = new System.Text.StringBuilder();
messageBoxCS.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "CellStyle", e.CellStyle );
messageBoxCS.AppendLine();
messageBoxCS.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "CellStyleScope", e.CellStyleScope );
messageBoxCS.AppendLine();
MessageBox.Show(messageBoxCS.ToString(), "CellStyleContentChanged Event" );
}

    Private Sub DataGridView1_CellStyleContentChanged(sender as Object, e as DataGridViewCellStyleContentChangedEventArgs) _ 
     Handles DataGridView1.CellStyleContentChanged

    Dim messageBoxVB as New System.Text.StringBuilder()
    messageBoxVB.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "CellStyle", e.CellStyle)
    messageBoxVB.AppendLine()
    messageBoxVB.AppendFormat("{0} = {1}", "CellStyleScope", e.CellStyleScope)
    messageBoxVB.AppendLine()
    MessageBox.Show(messageBoxVB.ToString(),"CellStyleContentChanged Event")

End Sub
